body.p: I beg to thank you cordially for your very obliging letter and its accompanying little book.Diary of Robert Melrose. Royal Emigrant’s Almanack Concerning Five Years Servitude under the Hudson’s Bay Company (n.d.): see Pilgrim Letters 11, p. 213 n.4. For CD’s warm if qualified response, see To Melrose, 11 June 1866 (Pilgrim Letters 11, p. 213). Do me the justice to believe that I should have done so sooner, but that both favors have only reached me just now on my return to my own home.CD had been largely out of London on his Spring reading tour, April-May (see Pilgrim Letters 11, p. 533).
